    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/donald-trump/charges-mueller-could-have-brought-against-russians-didn-t-n849006?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>The charges Mueller could have brought but didn't</title>
      <pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 15:54:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/donald-trump/charges-mueller-could-have-brought-against-russians-didn-t-n849006?cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator>Danny Cevallos</dc:creator>
      <description>Why would special counsel Robert Mueller allege illegal Russian activity in the election throughout the indictment, but not actually charge it?</description>
      <media:content url="http://media3.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2332126/180216-rod-rosenstein-ac-736p_6ed13561877921a48fb9039a2ccfdfe9.jpg" medium="image" height="1667" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Jacquelyn Martin</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Rod Rosenstein<media:description type="plain">Deputy Attorney General Rod Rosenstein announces on Feb. 16, 2018, that special counsel Robert Mueller has indicted 13 Russian nationals and several Russian entities with meddling in the 2016 presidential election.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/russia-s-lavrov-calls-fbi-indictments-just-blabber-n849001?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>'Just blabber': Russia's Lavrov dismisses FBI indictments</title>
      <pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 16:16:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/russia-s-lavrov-calls-fbi-indictments-just-blabber-n849001?cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator>Saphora Smith and Alex Holmes and Associated Press</dc:creator>
      <description>"Until we see the facts, everything else is just blabber," Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov told participants at the annual Munich Security Conference.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media2.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2332561/180217-lavrov-munich-1052a-rs_3fe1ba5586b3d08cc80f412929e4b2e2.JPG" medium="image" height="1940" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Ronald Wittek</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Sergey Lavrov<media:description type="plain">Russia's Sergey Lavrov at the Munich Security Conference on Saturday</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/politics-news/trump-blasts-fbi-over-parkland-shooting-says-too-much-time-n849121?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>Trump blasts FBI over shooting, says 'too much time' on Russia</title>
      <pubDate>Sun, 18 Feb 2018 16:24:59 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/politics-news/trump-blasts-fbi-over-parkland-shooting-says-too-much-time-n849121?cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator>Phil Helsel</dc:creator>
      <description>Trump tweeted the FBI missed signals before a school shooting, and "are spending too much time trying to prove Russian collusion with the Trump campaign."</description>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/politics-news/gop-sen-lankford-open-stronger-gun-background-checks-n849176?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>Sen. Lankford has 'no issue' with stronger gun background checks</title>
      <pubDate>Sun, 18 Feb 2018 15:39:41 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/politics-news/gop-sen-lankford-open-stronger-gun-background-checks-n849176?cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator>Kailani Koenig</dc:creator>
      <description>Republican Sen. James Lankford said Sunday he is open to stronger background checks for gun sales.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media2.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2333096/lankford_9f95c0b3a90157e7480f09939d73b837.png" medium="image" height="365" width="647">
        <media:credit></media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain"><media:description type="plain"></media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/elections/there-peanut-farmer-plains-field-2020-democrats-n848986?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>Is there a peanut farmer from Plains in the field of 2020 Dems?</title>
      <pubDate>Sun, 18 Feb 2018 13:32:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/elections/there-peanut-farmer-plains-field-2020-democrats-n848986?cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator>Steve Kornacki</dc:creator>
      <description>The signs are everywhere that the 2020 Democratic presidential field will be much larger than usual — maybe larger than ever.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media4.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2017_11/1933456/170315-jimmy-carter-in-1976-0503_b0c05f5134a96cba2d14526a04475702.jpg" medium="image" height="3003" width="2056">
        <media:credit>AP Photo, file</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Jimmy Carter in 1976<media:description type="plain">President-elect Jimmy Carter and wife Rosalynn at a victory party in Atlanta, Ga., on Nov. 3, 1976. Carter won the presidential election by 297 electoral votes to 241 for Gerald Ford. </media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media1.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2014_44/739606/141028-carter-gov-clinton-jms-2154_7e0452761f05df2993a9c12b85546f42.jpg" medium="image" height="1697" width="2500">
        <media:credit>John Duricka</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: President Jimmy Carter, left, and Gov. Bill Clinton<media:description type="plain">Then-President Jimmy Carter, left, and then-Arkansas Gov. Bill Clinton enjoy a chuckle during a rally for Carter, Wednesday, Oct. 22, 1980, Texarkana, Texas.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/facebook-plans-use-u-s-mail-verify-ids-election-ad-n849081?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>Facebook plans to use U.S. mail to verify IDs of election ad buyers</title>
      <pubDate>Sun, 18 Feb 2018 00:02:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/facebook-plans-use-u-s-mail-verify-ids-election-ad-n849081?cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator />
      <description>Facebook said Saturday it will start using mailed postcards to verify the identities location of election ad buyers. It comes after alleged Russian actions.</description>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/politics-news/special-counsel-mueller-charges-13-russians-interfering-2016-election-n848686?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>Special counsel charges 13 Russians with interfering in 2016 election to boost Trump</title>
      <pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 12:55:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/politics-news/special-counsel-mueller-charges-13-russians-interfering-2016-election-n848686?cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator>Adam Edelman and Julia Ainsley and Ken Dilanian and Tom Winter and Robert Windrem and Kristen Welker and Andrew Blankstein</dc:creator>
      <description>A federal grand jury on Friday indicted 13 Russian nationals and three Russian entities on charges related to interfering in the 2016 election.</description>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/white-house/trump-visits-parkland-shooting-victims-florida-hospital-n848826?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>Trump visits Parkland shooting victims at Florida hospital</title>
      <pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 01:52:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/white-house/trump-visits-parkland-shooting-victims-florida-hospital-n848826?cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator>Ali Vitali</dc:creator>
      <description>President Donald Trump and first lady Melania Trump visited a hospital and the sheriff's office in Broward County Friday evening following this week's mass shooting in Parkland, Florida.</description>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/white-house/veterans-affairs-dept-chief-staff-steps-down-after-travel-flap-n848831?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>VA's chief of staff steps down after travel flap</title>
      <pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 00:27:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/white-house/veterans-affairs-dept-chief-staff-steps-down-after-travel-flap-n848831?cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator>Associated Press</dc:creator>
      <description>The Department of Veterans Affairs says the agency's chief of staff has stepped down after an investigation found she had doctored emails to justify Secretary David Shulkin's wife accompanying him on an European trip at taxpayer expense.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media2.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2332101/180216-vivieca-wright-simpson-ac-716p_141686bd1a4bd05cdcbd1b824a4b5b3f.jpg" medium="image" height="2500" width="2195">
        <media:credit>VA</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Vivieca Wright Simpson<media:description type="plain">Vivieca Wright Simpson</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media2.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2332101/180216-vivieca-wright-simpson-ac-716p_141686bd1a4bd05cdcbd1b824a4b5b3f.jpg" medium="image" height="2500" width="2195">
        <media:credit>VA</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Vivieca Wright Simpson<media:description type="plain">Vivieca Wright Simpson</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/politics-news/information-warfare-how-russians-interfered-2016-election-n848746?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>'Information warfare': How Russians interfered in 2016 election</title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 23:15:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/politics-news/information-warfare-how-russians-interfered-2016-election-n848746?cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator>Dartunorro Clark</dc:creator>
      <description>Fake social media accounts, identify theft, VPNs: Mueller's indictment shows how Russia meddled in the 2016 election, disparaging Clinton and boosting Trump.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media1.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2331626/180216-trump-rally-obama-clinton-costume-njs-151p_6c8611c776da7860a299830870e2e5b1.jpg" medium="image" height="1666" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Jonathan Ernst</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: People dressed as Clinton and Obama in prison jumpsuits circulate in the crowd as Trump rallies with supporters in Tallahassee, Florida<media:description type="plain">People dressed as Democratic presidential nominee Hillary Clinton and President Barack Obama in prison jumpsuits circulate in the crowd as Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump rallies with supporters in Tallahassee, Florida, on Oct. 25, 2016.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media1.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2331626/180216-trump-rally-obama-clinton-costume-njs-151p_6c8611c776da7860a299830870e2e5b1.jpg" medium="image" height="1666" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Jonathan Ernst</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: People dressed as Clinton and Obama in prison jumpsuits circulate in the crowd as Trump rallies with supporters in Tallahassee, Florida<media:description type="plain">People dressed as Democratic presidential nominee Hillary Clinton and President Barack Obama in prison jumpsuits circulate in the crowd as Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump rallies with supporters in Tallahassee, Florida, on Oct. 25, 2016.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/white-house/white-house-overhauls-security-clearance-process-following-revelations-n848821?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>White House overhauls security clearance process</title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 23:10:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/white-house/white-house-overhauls-security-clearance-process-following-revelations-n848821?cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator>Mike Memoli and Carol E. Lee</dc:creator>
      <description>Dozens of White House officials could lose access to sensitive information</description>
      <media:content url="http://media4.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2331831/180216-john-kelly-white-house-ew-428p_4a36f108e3ae4624ed0abcd04f78df64.jpg" medium="image" height="1667" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Chip Somodevilla</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: President Trump Unveils His Infrastructure Initiative With State And Local Officials In The State Dining Room Of White House<media:description type="plain">White House Chief of Staff John Kelly listens to local and state officials during a meeting where U.S. President Donald Trump unveiled his administration's long-awaited infrastructure plan in the State Dining Room at the White House Feb. 12, 2018 in Washington, DC.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/donald-trump/trump-critics-still-think-russia-investigation-hoax-n848731?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>Dems to Trump: Still think Russia inquiry is a 'hoax'?</title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 22:28:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/donald-trump/trump-critics-still-think-russia-investigation-hoax-n848731?cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator>Jane C. Timm </dc:creator>
      <description>Democrats lashed out at President Donald Trump after the investigation he's called a "hoax" and a "witch hunt" resulted in 13 indictments of Russian nationals.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media4.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2331716/180216-nancy-pelosi-russia-investigation-ew-249p_90fe5228a03d5dc8741755c41608b027.jpg" medium="image" height="1730" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Mark Wilson</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">House Democrats Call On GOP To Investigate Trump Administration Ties To Russia<media:description type="plain">Democratic Leader Nancy Pelosi speaks during a news conference on Capitol Hill, July 14, 2017 in Washington, DC.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/white-house/white-house-russian-indictments-show-no-collusion-trump-campaign-n848761?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>White House: Russian indictments show 'no collusion' with Trump campaign</title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 21:40:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/white-house/white-house-russian-indictments-show-no-collusion-trump-campaign-n848761?cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator>Adam Edelman</dc:creator>
      <description>Trump, his outside counsel, and the White House lauded the indictment of Russian nationals, with the president insisting they proved there was "no collusion."</description>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/politics-news/trump-s-russia-narrative-upended-mueller-indictments-n848711?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>Mueller calls Trump's Russia bluff</title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 21:23:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/politics-news/trump-s-russia-narrative-upended-mueller-indictments-n848711?cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator>Jonathan Allen</dc:creator>
      <description>Special Counsel Robert Mueller's indictment of 13 Russian nationals undermines President Donald Trump's claim that there was no election interference.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media1.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2330596/ss-180215-twip-09_a1de66852f85bb458dbdc8c43e34b664.jpg" medium="image" height="1667" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Mandel Ngan</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image:<media:description type="plain">President Donald Trump attends the National Prayer Breakfast at a hotel in Washington on Feb. 8.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/elections/gop-s-midterm-mission-selling-tax-cuts-begins-now-n848606?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>GOP's midterm mission of selling tax cuts begins now</title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 19:41:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/elections/gop-s-midterm-mission-selling-tax-cuts-begins-now-n848606?cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator>Heidi Przybyla</dc:creator>
      <description>The U.S. Chamber of Commerce joins a growing GOP offensive to sell their tax cuts between now and the November midterm elections.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media4.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2330541/180215-trump-ohio-treason-ew-558_25e63519b8a64baf1df576156e72bc8b.jpg" medium="image" height="1666" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Jonathan Ernst</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Trump and the first lady travel to Ohio for events on opioid addiction and tax policy<media:description type="plain">U.S. President Donald Trump delivers remarks on his tax policy after a factory tour of the Sheffer Corporation in Blue Ash, Ohio on Feb. 5, 2018.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/first-read/russia-timeline-key-players-meetings-investigation-details-n840786?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>Russia timeline: Key players, meetings and investigation details</title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 18:56:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/first-read/russia-timeline-key-players-meetings-investigation-details-n840786?cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator>NBC News</dc:creator>
      <description>As special counsel Mueller continues his inquiries into Russia collusion in the 2016 election, new information continues to be added to the timeline of facts.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media1.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_04/2305776/180125-russia-timeline-inline-se-527p_76b7ea52e37da9eaf59e672c0fd09642.jpg" medium="image" height="350" width="2400">
        <media:credit>EPA, AP, Reuters, AFP - Getty Images</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Vladimir Putin, Jeff Sessions, Donald Trump, Paul Manafort, Donald Trump Jr., James Comey<media:description type="plain"></media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/donald-trump/former-playboy-model-claims-she-had-affair-trump-report-says-n848601?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>Former Playboy model claims she had an affair with Trump, report says</title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 17:21:56 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/donald-trump/former-playboy-model-claims-she-had-affair-trump-report-says-n848601?cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator>Daniel Arkin</dc:creator>
      <description>Karen McDougal, a former Playboy Playmate of the Year, documented her alleged affair with Trump in an eight-page handwritten note shared with Ronan Farrow of The New Yorker.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media3.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2331221/180216-karen-mcdougal-playmate-njs-837a_537436c09d0d67bb0ea799eb53730ccd.jpg" medium="image" height="2500" width="1667">
        <media:credit>Bennett Raglin</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Former Playboy model Karen McDougal<media:description type="plain">Karen McDougal, Playboy Playmate of the Year in 1998, attends a Playboy party in Miami Beach, Florida, on Feb. 6, 2010.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/politics-news/top-democrat-says-obama-shares-responsibility-russia-s-meddling-n848661?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>Top Dem says Obama shares responsibility for Russia's meddling</title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 16:59:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/politics-news/top-democrat-says-obama-shares-responsibility-russia-s-meddling-n848661?cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator>Mike Memoli</dc:creator>
      <description>The Obama administration's muted response to the 2014 Sony hack may have laid the groundwork for Russia's meddling in the 2016 elections, says one top Democrat.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media2.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_05/2282206/180104-adam-schiff-mn-1545_5c6b6c690e7c5073ad9a23145220dac5.jpg" medium="image" height="1911" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Carolyn Kaster</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Adam Schiff<media:description type="plain">Rep. Adam Schiff of California, ranking Democrat on the Intelligence Committee, at the U.S. Capitol in December.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/congress/outspoken-pro-trump-pastor-mark-burns-joins-race-gowdy-seat-n848516?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>Outspoken pro-Trump pastor enters race for Gowdy seat</title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 15:49:01 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/congress/outspoken-pro-trump-pastor-mark-burns-joins-race-gowdy-seat-n848516?cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator>Ali Vitali</dc:creator>
      <description>Vocal Trump supporter and televangelist pastor Mark Burns joins a cast of characters who've tried to parlay loyalty to Trump into a ticket to Washington.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media2.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2331086/180216-mark-burns-rd-1240a_71c5baf607f98fea26ebfa1d1773796e.jpg" medium="image" height="2843" width="4149">
        <media:credit>Carolyn Kaster</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Mark Burns<media:description type="plain">Pastor Mark Burns delivers the benediction at the close of the afternoon session during the opening day of the Republican National Convention in Cleveland on July 18, 2016.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/politics-news/mitt-romney-announces-bid-u-s-senate-utah-n848591?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>Mitt Romney announces bid for U.S. Senate in Utah</title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 14:02:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/politics-news/mitt-romney-announces-bid-u-s-senate-utah-n848591?cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator>Adam Edelman</dc:creator>
      <description>Mitt Romney — the GOP's 2012 candidate for president and a former governor of Massachusetts — announced Friday that he would run for U.S. Senate in Utah.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media4.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2331166/180216-romney-732a-rs_db6943dd7a2c795ca53eb111df29e789.JPG" medium="image" height="1667" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Jabin Botsford</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Mitt Romney talks to the media after meeting with President-elect Donald Trump and Vice President-elect Mike Pence at the Trump National Golf Club Bedminster clubhouse in New Jersey on Nov. 19, 2016.<media:description type="plain">Mitt Romney talks to the media after meeting with President-elect Donald Trump and Vice President-elect Mike Pence at the Trump National Golf Club Bedminster clubhouse in New Jersey on Nov. 19, 2016.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/first-read/trump-picks-politics-over-policy-immigration-vote-n848616?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>

      <pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 13:46:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/first-read/trump-picks-politics-over-policy-immigration-vote-n848616?cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator>Chuck Todd and Mark Murray  and Carrie Dann</dc:creator>
      <description>The president and his team chose to push a bill that could muster only 39 Senate votes.</description>
    </item>

    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/white-house/after-florida-shooting-trump-offers-comfort-gun-owners-n848306?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>After Florida shooting, Trump offers comfort — to gun owners</title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 06:42:03 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/white-house/after-florida-shooting-trump-offers-comfort-gun-owners-n848306?cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator>Jonathan Allen</dc:creator>
      <description>In Thursday's remarks following this week's shooting rampage at a Florida high school, President Donald Trump offered reassurance to gun-rights advocates.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media2.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2330356/180215-trump-speech-gun-owners-ew-230p_70c56a4441c9d4bc54ceb860ba19ce74.jpg" medium="image" height="1637" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Carolyn Kaster</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Donald Trump<media:description type="plain">President Donald Trump arrives to speak in the Diplomatic Room of the White House, in Washington on Feb 15, 2018, about the tragic school shooting in Parkland, Florida.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/white-house/scores-top-white-house-officials-lack-permanent-security-clearances-n848191?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>Scores of top White House officials lack full security clearances</title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 03:52:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/white-house/scores-top-white-house-officials-lack-permanent-security-clearances-n848191?cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator>Carol E. Lee and Mike Memoli and Kristen Welker and Rich Gardella</dc:creator>
      <description>More than 130 White House political appointees working lacked permanent security clearances as of November 2017, including the president's daughter and son-in-law.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media4.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2329516/180214-don-mcgahn-2016-ac-806p_1b4d7360c69945ca8f8155e5954494f1.jpg" medium="image" height="1666" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Drew Angerer</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: President-Elect Donald Trump Holds Meetings At His Trump Tower Residence In New York<media:description type="plain">Don McGahn, general counsel for the Trump transition team, gets into an elevator in the lobby at Trump Tower, November 15, 2016 in New York.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media2.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2329511/180214-sarah-huckabee-sanders-ac-808p_1b4d7360c69945ca8f8155e5954494f1.jpg" medium="image" height="1667" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Chip Somodevilla</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: White House Press Press Secretary Sarah Sanders Holds Press Briefing At White House<media:description type="plain">White House Press Secretary Sarah Huckabee Sanders calls on reporters during a press briefing at the White House February 12, 2018 in Washington.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media2.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2329521/180214-dan-scavino-ac-836p_1b4d7360c69945ca8f8155e5954494f1.jpg" medium="image" height="1667" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Al Drago</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Former Senator Bob Dole is presented with the congressional Gold Medal<media:description type="plain">Dan Scavino Jr., White House director of social media, attends a congressional Gold Medal ceremony for former Senator Bob Dole on January 17, 2018 in Washington.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/donald-trump/trump-vows-mental-health-care-fix-after-florida-shooting-he-n848481?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>Trump vows mental health care fix. He also wants to slash coverage.</title>
      <pubDate>Thu, 15 Feb 2018 23:06:00 GMT</pubDate>

      <dc:creator>Jane C. Timm </dc:creator>
      <description>The president is already playing a role when it comes to health care. Here's what he's done and how it would affect mental heath in America.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media1.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2330486/180215-trump-speaks-mental-health-ew-453p_35db9dd676085312b52a4b45553aad51.jpg" medium="image" height="1667" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Michael Reynolds</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: US President Donald J. Trump delivers remarks on the shooting in Parkland, Florida<media:description type="plain">U.S. President Donald J. Trump delivers remarks on the 14 February shooting at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School in Parkland, Florida; in the Diplomatic Reception Room of the White House in Washington on Feb. 15, 2018.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
    </item>
